author: Staff Reporter
text:
Minister for Backward Class and Minorities S. Abdul Rahim has filed a criminal defamation complaint against Tamil weekly Ananda Vikatan for allegedly carrying a defamatory report about him. City Public Prosecutor M.L. Jegan on Tuesday moved the complaint on behalf of the Minister before the Principal Sessions Court here .

The prosecutor alleged that the weekly, in its publication dated July 7, 2014, had levelled baseless charges against the Minister in a bid to defame his reputation.

He sought the court to initiate defamation proceeding against the weekly’s editor and publisher.

Summon to editor

Meanwhile, in a defamation case filed by Ministers Mukkur N. Subramanian, T. K. M. Chinnayya and ‘Thopu’ Venkatachalam, the Principal Sessions Court has summoned the editor and publisher of Ananda Vikatan to appear before the court on February 1.
title: Minister sues Tamil weekly
